result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas R Thompson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas R Thompson was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Nicholas R Thompson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

9:46 AM Defendant Nicholas R Thompson in court with Attorney Mark A Leonard.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 and 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #3 and 4. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, cc to count 2 and 22CM94 and 22CM800 and Columbia Co. Case No. 18CF548

COUNT #2   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, cc to Count 1 and 22CM94 and 22CM800 and Columbia Co. Case No. 18CF548

CONDITIONS:
-No contact with: DM
-Not use/possess alcohol
-Absolute Sobriety
-6 months on an alcohol monitoring sobrietor or an equivalent  
-- No bars, taverns or liquor stores or any other business whose primary business is the sale of alcohol 
-DNA on file
-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1 and 2
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved.

-Bond posted to be applied to fines and cc only and remainder returned to poster.

-Days credit for time already served:  zero days credit
-Days credit if revoked: zero days credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes sent to DOC
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State. Attorney Mark A. Leonard appeared in person with Defn. Plea/sentencing scheduled, NIH.
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas R Thompson in court.  Attorney Mark A Leonard in court for Nicholas R Thompson. Defn requests STC, notice given to Defn in court.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Daniel M.

02:56 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
